access/api.title: API
access/api.description: The private feeds can be created through the Sesamy Checkout flow but it's also possible to create private links for existing customers as a publisher.

access/configuration/configuration.title: Configuration
access/configuration/configuration.description: The Sesamy Access service can be configured in a variaty of ways depending on how the premium content is stored and if Sesamy Access is serving the public feed.

access/configuration/description-fallbac.title: Description Fallback
access/configuration/description-fallbac.description: As many podcast hosting services doesn't support the access XML tags there's a fallback to add the same information in the episode descriptions.

access/configuration/sources.title: Sources
access/configuration/sources.description: Sesamy Access can pull content from multiple sources when creating a new feed. Each source can be configured to either public or private.

access/configuration/xml-extension.title: XML Extension
access/configuration/xml-extension.description: Sesamy access uses the Access XML extention for both reading and writing RSS.

access/getting-started.title: Getting Started
access/getting-started.description: Sesamy Access makes it possible to sell single episodes, seasons and bundles of shows.

analytics/analytics.title: Analytics
analytics/analytics.description: Sesamy Analytics is a lightweight solution for tracking page views, custom events and identifying visitors. It is intended to be a complement to other analytics solution to better understand how the content is consumed.

analytics/events.title: Events
analytics/events.description: The analytics registers three types of events:

analytics/GDPR.title: GDPR
analytics/GDPR.description: Sesamy Analytics is designed from the start to be GDPR complient. It does not rely on Cookies and does not require any end user consent.

authentication/getting-started.title: Getting Started
authentication/getting-started.description: Sesamy authentication service is an easy and secure way to add user management to any app or website. The user accounts are common for all websites using the Sesamy Authentication making it easier for the customers to get started with a new service.

authentication/oauth2/client-credentials.title: Client Credentials
authentication/oauth2/client-credentials.description: The Client Credentials grant is used when applications request an access token to access their own resources, not on behalf of a user.

authentication/oauth2/code-grant.title: Code Grant
authentication/oauth2/code-grant.description: The code grant flow works similar to the implicit grant flow, but instead of returning the access token directly to the browser a code is returned. This code can be resolved to a token using the client_secret.

authentication/oauth2/implicit-grant.title: Implicit Grant
authentication/oauth2/implicit-grant.description: With the implicit grant flow the user is redirected from the login form to the publishers website with the token passed as query string.

authentication/oauth2/oauth2.title: Oauth 2
authentication/oauth2/oauth2.description: OAuth is an open standard to authorization. OAuth provides client applications a ‘secure delegated access’ to server resources on behalf of a resource owner. It specifies a process for resource owners to authorize third-party access to their server resources without sharing their credentials.

authentication/scopes.title: Scopes
authentication/scopes.description: When creating a new user session it is possible to specify what the user will be able to access during this session by requesting various scopes.

intro.title: Sesamy Documentation
intro.description: Explore our guides and examples to integrate Sesamy.

news-widget/meta-tags.title: Meta Tags
news-widget/meta-tags.description: When a new article or post is created it is added to the catalog of products either by using the meta tags of the page or the sesamy-content-data tag.

news-widget/news-widget.title: News Widgets
news-widget/news-widget.description: The news widgets are a collection of web components that are used to purchase and unlock content on 3rd party websites.

news-widget/passes.title: Passes
news-widget/passes.description: A pass is used to package a set of posts in a bundle. The typical use case is to offer a subscription for all articles on a website, but it could be used to package just a section of the content and it could be both single purchase or subscription.

news-widget/unlocking-content.title: Unlocking Content
news-widget/unlocking-content.description: When a user has purchased a post the unlocked content can be displayed using the sesamy-content-container component. The content can either be embedded directly on the page or fetched from the server using a signed url.

news-widget/web-components/sesamy-conten.title: sesamy-content-container
news-widget/web-components/sesamy-conten.description: The content container component displays either the locked preview version of the content or the the actual content depending on if the user has access.

news-widget/web-components/sesamy-conten.title: sesamy-content-data
news-widget/web-components/sesamy-conten.description: The content data web component is only used as a central metadata storage for an article that other web components can fall back to and doesn't contain any other functionality.

news-widget/web-components/sesamy-conten.title: sesamy-content-listing
news-widget/web-components/sesamy-conten.description: The content listings component is used for tracking which articles have been viewed in a list of articles.

news-widget/web-components/sesamy-entitl.title: sesamy-entitlements
news-widget/web-components/sesamy-entitl.description: The purchases component displays a list of the users purchases. It could for instance be used on a user profile website.

news-widget/web-components/sesamy-profil.title: sesamy-profile
news-widget/web-components/sesamy-profil.description: The profile component displays the name and email of the current user. It could for instance be used on a user profile website
